description: System for monitoring custom metrics for a bridge node using Prometheus and Node Exporter. Node Exporter is a powerful tool that collects operating system and hardware metrics from servers and can also be extended to expose custom metrics.

options.content:
Celestia Bridge metrics

by Cumulo

panels.description: Bridge node block height
panels.title: Bridge height

panels.description: Last installed version of the node
panels.title: Node version

panels.description: Returns the chain-id of the node
panels.title: Node Chain-id

panels.description: Date/time of last node reboot
panels.title: Time Started Bridge node

panels.description: Peer-to-peer (P2P) outgoing connection status. Returns the most recent status of the celestia-bridge service connection. If the status is âestablishedâ it indicates that the connection has been successfully established.
panels.title: Canonical Peer Status

panels.description: Current height of the block in the Celestia consensus system
panels.title: Consensus Height

panels.description: Either NO SYNC (not block syncing) or SYNC (syncing)
panels.title: SYNC STATUS

panels.description: Last height the node signed a block, if the node is a validator. The recommended value for the consensus node connected to the bridge is NO VALIDATOR
panels.title: Node Last Signed Height

panels.description: Indicates whether a consensus node is synchronising its state
panels.title: State Syncing

panels.description: Number of times network connectivity has timed out
panels.title: Num Timeout Connectivity

panels.description: Num second from last date timeout occurred while waiting for network connectivity
panels.title: Last Timeout Connectivity

panels.description: Counting the number of timestamp analysis errors. This message indicates an error when trying to parse a timestamp in a record. A problem may have occurred with the format of the timestamp.
panels.title: Num Failed to parse timestamp

panels.description: Num second from last Failed to parse timestamp
panels.title: Last Failed to parse timestamp

panels.description: Counting the number of closed by remote host
panels.title: Num Connection closed by remote host
Time Last Connection closed by remote host

panels.description: Frequency distribution for cache life expectancy, expressed in seconds.
panels.title: Cache life expectancy (in seconds)

panels.description: Busy state of all CPU cores together

targets.expr: (sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode!="idle"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))) * 100

panels.title: CPU Busy

panels.description: Busy state of all CPU cores together (5 min average)
panels.title: Sys Load (5m avg)

panels.description: Busy state of all CPU cores together (15 min average)
panels.title: Sys Load (15m avg)

panels.description: Non available RAM memory
panels.title: RAM Used

panels.description: Used Swap
panels.title: SWAP Used

panels.description: Used Root FS
panels.title: Root FS Used

panels.description: Total number of CPU cores
panels.title: CPU Cores

panels.description: System uptime
panels.title: Uptime

panels.description: Total RootFS
panels.title: RootFS Total

panels.description: Basic CPU info

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="system"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="user"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="iowait"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode=~".*irq"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode!='idle',mode!='user',mode!='system',mode!='iowait',mode!='irq',mode!='softirq'}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="idle"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))

panels.title: CPU Basic

panels.description: Basic memory usage

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

panels.title: Memory Basic

panels.description: Basic network info per interface
panels.title: Network Traffic Basic

panels.description: Disk space used of all filesystems mounted
panels.title: Disk Space Used Basic

title: Celestia Bridge Node
